arm_group.description: A chocolate milkshake with a normal calcium content will be consumed daily (235 kcal; 13 g protein; 42 g carbohydrate; 1 g fat, 400 mg calcium per serving).
A chocolate milkshake with a high calcium content will be consumed daily (235 kcal; 13 g protein; 42 g carbohydrate; 1 g fat, 1400 mg calcium per serving).

brief_summary.textblock:
A high-calcium intake can accelerate fat loss under energy-restricted diets. Part of this
      may be due to a shift in substrate metabolism where there is an increase in the rate of fat
      oxidation. However, whether high-calcium intake can influence substrate metabolism during
      exercise is not known. Accordingly, we aim to investigate the effect of 2 weeks of
      high-calcium intake on substrate metabolism during exercise.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of High-calcium Intake on Substrate Metabolism During Exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Physically active (moderate-vigorous exercise >3 time per week)

          -  Male

          -  18-40 yrs of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Smoker

          -  Known Food Allergies

          -  Metabolic disorders

intervention.description: Milk-extracted calcium supplement will be used to modulate the calcium content of the milkshakes used.

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of a Calcium Supplementation on Lipid Metabolism During Exercise.

other_outcome.description: Parathyroid hormone concentrations will be determined at rest before and after supplementation periods as a indicator of calcium status.
Glucose-dependent insulinotropic peptide concentrations will be determined at rest before and after supplementation periods as a potential mechanism of any changes in metabolism.
Glucagon-like peptide-1 concentrations will be determined at rest before and after supplementation periods as a potential mechanism of any changes in metabolism.

primary_outcome.description: Substrate metabolism will be assessed by the respiratory exchange ratio (rate of carbon dioxide production/rate of oxygen consumption) from samples of expired gas collected during the first 15 minutes of an incremental cycling test.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 60 s samples every 3 min for 15 min

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Non-esterified fatty acid concentrations will be determined from plasma samples collected during the first 15 minutes of an incremental cycling test to indicate fatty acid availability.
Glycerol concentrations will be determined from plasma samples collected during the first 15 minutes of an incremental cycling test as a marker of lipolysis.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
